page.description: Imports a table from an external ODBC source, or an Access, Excel, or Outlook file, to an Alpha Five table.
page.syntax: C odbc_import_table(C type ,C source_filename_or_dsn ,C table_to_create ,C sql_statement [,C password [,C user_name ]])

argument.name: source_filename_or_dsn
argument.description: Full filename and path of the source database.

argument.name: table_to_create
argument.description: Full filename and path of the Alpha table to create.

argument.name: sql_statement
argument.description: An SQL expression that selects the records used to create the new Alpha table.

argument.name: password
argument.description: Where required by the external database: password.

argument.name: user_name
argument.description: Where required by the external database: user name.

page.discussion: ODBC_IMPORT_TABLE() imports a data from an external source and creates an Alpha table. A good way to get sample code is to select File > Import > ODBC Import Genie. Step through the import process. On the last screen, click Show Xbasic. Copy the Xbasic code to your project. Note : The ODBC_IMPORT_TABLE() function requires the installation of < span class=Screen>Microsoft Data Access Components.
page.example: odbc_import_table("ACCESS","C:\Samples\Company.mdb","C:\Databases\Functions\Company.dbf","select * from company","","") odbc_import_table("EXCEL","C:\Samples\Company.xls","C:\Databases\Functions\Books.dbf","select * from sheet1$","","") odbc_import_table("OUTLOOK","Personal Folders","C:\Databases\Functions\Contacts.dbf","select * from contacts","","")
